text: Mark Iehielvich Freidkin (; 14 April 1953 - 4 March 2014) was a Soviet and Russian poet, writer, translator, and singer. He wrote three books of prose. He was born in Leninobod (now Khujand, Tajikstan) and studied in Moscow. He was of Jewish descent. Freidkin died after a long illness on 4 March 2014 in Moscow. He was 60. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1953 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Disease-related deaths in Moscow Category:Russian Jews Category:Russian poets Category:Russian singers Category:Russian writers Category:Soviet Jews Category:Soviet singers Category:Soviet writers Category:Russian translators
title: Mark Freidkin
